title: Game periodically freezes for a few seconds
body:
Whenever the first tower is destroyed or the first time I die in a match or at seemingly random but fairly infrequent points throughout (maybe 3 random times per match, and always during combat), the game will freeze for around 2 seconds. Also changing graphics settings didn't seem to have any impact on this. (I run at a pretty steady 60 fps on medium high anyway.)

What can I do to fix this?
I'm guessing it has something to do with bad caching but I don't know how to influence that.

replies.body:
This is an interesting situation. I suspect there may be some driver or local system settings that may be causing this issue. [This guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) is likely a good starting point in troubleshooting and resolving this for good.

Let me know if you continue to have issues with this.

This seems to be the issue. ( [link](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2v775u/anyone_having_random_12_second_screen_freezes/cofeq9y ) : drive stopping during game)
because keeping a download going while in game seems to prevent the problem. not 100% sure though, as I didn't remember to keep track during the two (very intense hexakill) games I played with the download up
Fascinating! Have you tried using the No APM application that was mention by the OP?
That may be a good next step if the FPS troubleshooting guide I sent yielded no results.

while looking through this, I discovered R3d logs
Is it normal to have about two thousand instances of "ERROR| Cant load particle system" in each log?

Also less relevant, what is "AnnieBasicAttack_mis.troy", and why does the game attempt to preload it every game when Annie isn't in the game?

As with most error logs, r3d logs can contain a number of errors that are listed, but don't actually affect anything. This holds true if you looked at your Event Viewer and found your system logs for Windows.

I wouldn't read too much into what you're seeing in those logs at this time. Let me know if you have any questions.
